definition: to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences

sentences.english: Kenny is not good-looking, but he is very gentle.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼长得不好看，但是他很有绅士风度。

sentences.english: She said he was a very good-looking man and a gentleman .
sentences.chinese: 据她说，他是一个风度翩翩，很有教养的人。

sentences.english: In fact, it is thought to be ungentlemanly.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，那是会被认为没有绅士风度的。

sentences.english: Don't get even. Just get out with your hard-earned professionalism still intact.
sentences.chinese: 只是带着你辛苦得到的职业风度安静的离开。

sentences.english: But she acted with graciousness and hospitality.
sentences.chinese: 但是她表现得既有风度又热情的款待。

sentences.english: Fearey had all the charm and urbanity of the trained diplomat .
sentences.chinese: 费尔里具备一个训练有素的外交官的一切风度和优雅。
风度是一种很难界定的品质。

sentences.english: Midday, we in situ round and round, and strong to keep poise.
sentences.chinese: 正午，我们在原地绕圈圈，并坚强地保持风度。

sentences.english: His countenance was thoroughly good-humoured; and his manners were as friendly as the style of his letter.
sentences.chinese: 他和颜悦色，那风度就像他的信一样亲切友好。

sentences.english: He's a personable entertainer and I hope people see that in him.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位风度翩翩的艺人而我希望人们能这样看他。

sentences.english: Englishmen were regarded as the most gentlemanly people in the world.
sentences.chinese: 英国男子曾被认为是世界上最有绅士风度的人。

sentences.english: Blair was a self-styled regular guy with buckets of charm.
sentences.chinese: 布莱尔风度翩翩，自诩为受欢迎的人。

sentences.english: He demeaned himself like a gentleman.
sentences.chinese: 他举止颇有些绅士风度。

sentences.english: These attributes should be countenanced by the expression and behavior.
sentences.chinese: 这些品质透过表情和风度体现出来。

sentences.english: The manly Roman woman manager by the flag had manasmanner.
sentences.chinese: 军旗旁那位有良人风致的古罗马女经理具有良人风度。

sentences.english: Noon, we have in place around the circle, and maintain a strong demeanor.
sentences.chinese: 正午，我们在原地绕圈圈，并坚强地保持风度。

definition: cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
neither servile nor overbearing (idiom)/neither obsequious nor supercilious
